intro: Dianella intermedia f. bicolor, commonly known as the variegated flax lily, is a striking ornamental plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its sword-shaped, variegated leaves that display a mix of green, white, and pink hues. The plant produces small, bell-shaped white or pink flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it suitable for shaded garden settings. Its unique foliage makes it a popular choice for ornamental landscaping and container gardening.
